tit.e: Honcho monzui (Anthology of waka poems and prose written in classical Chinese)
tit.cmt: capitalized "Monzui" since this is a title; eliminated content in parenthesis since it is usually in the first sentence

sen.j: 『本朝文粋』（ほんちょうもんずい）は藤原明衡の編纂による。
sen.e: The "Honcho monzui" (Anthology of waka poems and prose written in classical Chinese) was compiled by FUJIWARA no Akihira.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The "Honcho Monzui" (Anthology of waka poems and prose written in classical Chinese) was compiled by FUJIWARA no Akihira.

sen.j: 平安時代の秀いでた詩や文章400餘篇を集めた漢詩文の選集である。
sen.e: This collection includes more than 400 excellent Chinese poems and prose composed in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This collection includes more than 400 masterful Chinese poems and prose composed during the Heian period.
This collection includes more than 400 masterful Chinese poems and prose composed during the Heian period.

sen.j: 成立した年代については、明衡が文章博士や東宮博士の要職に就いた晩年期の康平年間ではないかと推定されている。
sen.e: As for the era in which this collection was compiled, it is estimated to have been during the Kohei era, when Akihira was appointed to some important posts such as Monjo hakase (professor of literature) and Togu Hakase in his later years.

This collection is estimated to have been compiled during the Kohei era when Akihira was appointed to a number of important posts, such as Monjo hakase (professor of literature) and Togu hakase (professor for the crown prince) in his later years.

sen.e: This collection is estimated to have been compiled during the Kohei era when Akihira was appointed to a number of important posts, such as Monjo hakase (professor of literature) and Togu hakase (professor for the crown prince) in his later years.

sen.j: すなわち本書編纂の為に多くの公文書の記述使用が覗い知れるからである。
sen.e: In other words, it is because he seems to have used a lot of descriptions from various official documents to compile this collection.
More specifically, Akihira seems to have used many descriptions from various official documents to compile this collection.
sen.cmt: In other words→ More specifically; he→Akihira;

sen.j: 原典の構成は、14巻・39部門に分類される。
sen.e: The original text was composed of fourteen volumes and thirty-nine parts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（三文に分割） 原文中「文選 (書物)」の（書物）という言葉については、文脈から書物であることが明らかなため、訳文では削除しました。
sen.e: The original text was composed of fourteen volumes and thirty-nine sections.
The original text was composed of 14 volumes and 39 sections.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字に表記しました。

sen.j: 文体は中国の『文選 (書物)』に倣ったものであるが、日本独自の仏教関連の願文や、文章・和歌等もある。
sen.e: Although the style followed the Chinese work "Monzen" (Wen-hsuan, ancient Chinese poems), it also includes ganmon (written prayers related to Buddhism) that were unique to Japan, prose and waka poetry.

sen.e: This indicates his intention to try improving it to make it more suitable for contemporary Japanese social circumstances.

sen.j: 四六駢儷文で表記されている。
sen.e: It is written in the form of shiroku benreibun (a prose style with a pattern of 4- and 6- character rhythms).

sen.j: 本邦初の文使用編纂書であり、公文書が多数含まれている事から故実典例として参考にされた。
sen.e: It was the first compilation in Japan that used writings, and it was used as a reference of ancient rites and authoritative precedents because it incorporated a lot of official documents.

sen.e: However, people paid no attention to it in the Edo period, when the benreibun came to be rejected.

sen.e: Still, it is a valuable historical source to learn about the zeitgeist of Japan and the sense of beauty in the Heian period.
